speaker: Bloggers
vclaim: He says "Kert Russell supports Trump" by wearing T-shirt Trump.
date: stated on November 6, 2018 in a Facebook post:
title: The photo of Kurt Russell in Trump's shirt was faked.
text: An old photo of actors Kurt Russell and Goldie Haun reappearing claiming that Russell is supporting Trump. Photo, published on May 9, 2016, on the Facebook page "Florida Fiarters for TRUMP," shows Russell and Haun walking down the pavement, Russell's shirt shows a picture of Trump carrying a weapon and refers to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, more commonly known as ISIS. "We're gonna hit the hell out of ISIS," reads the shirt. The address with the photo is also called "Stevin (Thor) McCaffrey," a reference to the 1991 film "Bakdrag," in which Chicago Fireman Russell plays. This story was highlighted as part of Facebook ' s efforts to combat false news and misleading information in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The Facebook page, which immediately posted the photo, did not respond to a letter requesting evidence of its claim. The search for the image shows that the image has been faked. On January 18, 2021, in an interview with the right national radio program, "China was behind intervention and effort to overthrow our government and elections, electoral fraud." By Daniel Funk - January 19, 2021, the picture was taken two years ago when he was a mortar and a Russell in Los Angeles, according to the September 2015 article of Bobsoger. They can be seen walking together, holding their hands and wearing the same clothes as modified images - only without American flags or references to Trump or ISIS on their white shirts. This is not the first time Russell has been associated with the viral social media. A photo was recently posted on Facebook with a quote from Russell Yadhid Trump. We've evaluated those pants on fire. Our modified photo attempts to photograph Russell and Haun as supporters of Trump, adding "Trap 2016," American flags and more to their shirts. The search for pictures quickly shows that these costumes are not the original ones that the couple was wearing. We're assessing this allegation pants on fire!
